title: 200 Followers Problem
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\\displaystyle \\int_{0}^{-\\infty} \\left [ 2^{at} \\zeta(bt) - 2^{c-dt} \\zeta(t) \\right ] \\ dt"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"\n\n"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"If "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"S = \\log_{2}{e} - \\log_{4}{e} + \\log_{6}{e} - \\log_{8}{e} \\ldots"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" can be expressed as the integral above for positive integers "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"a,b,c,d"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" are positive integers, find the value of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"200(a^2 + b^2 + c^2 - \\sqrt{8d})"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Well, nice problem! "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f(x) = {log}_{2}e - {log}_{4}e + {log}_{6}e..."}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"We know that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"{log}_{a}b = \frac{ln(b)}{ln(a)}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Hence, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"f(x)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" becomes -"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\displaystyle \sum_{k=1}^{\infty}{\frac{{(-1)}^{k-1}}{ln(2k)}}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Now, we know that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\displaystyle \int{{a}^{x}} = \frac{{a}^{x}}{ln(a)}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Io, we have got the natural logarithm in the denominator!"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"We here would try to guess about the bounds. As we can see, we need "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" in the numerator and that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"{a}^{0} = 1"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":". Also, the 2nd bound must make the function zero. Well... what's "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"ln(0)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"? You got it right - "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"-\infty"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", so we have got the other too."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\displaystyle \frac{1}{ln(2k)} = \int_{-\infty}^{0}{{(2k)}^{x}}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Well, we can do 2 more things,"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\displaystyle \frac{1}{ln(2k)} = (-1)(-1)\int_{0}^{-\infty}{{(2k)}^{-x}}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Put in the sum,"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\displaystyle \sum_{k=1}^{\infty}{{(-1)}^{k-1}\int_{0}^{-\infty}{{(2k)}^{-x}}}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Getting integral sign outside,"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\displaystyle \int_{0}^{-\infty}{\sum_{k=1}^{\infty}{\frac{{(-1)}^{k-1}}{{(2k)}^{x}}}}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\displaystyle \int_{0}^{-\infty}{{2}^{-x}\sum_{k=1}^{\infty}{\frac{{(-1)}^{k-1}}{{k}^{x}}}}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Now, we will first find out the sum - "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"We know "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\displaystyle \zeta(x) = \sum_{k=1}^{\infty}{\frac{1}{{a}^{x}}}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Multiplying "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"{2}^{1-x}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" both sides,"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\displaystyle ({2}^{1-x}\zeta(x) = \sum_{k=1}^{\infty}{\frac{2}{{2a}^{x}}}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Subtracting these 2 equations(1-2),"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\displaystyle {2}^{-x}({2}^x - 2)\zeta(x) = \sum_{k=1}^{\infty}{\frac{{(-1)}^{k-1}}{{a}^{x}}}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Hence, the function under integral sign equates to "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\displaystyle {2}^{-2x}({2}^{x} - 2)\zeta(x) = {2}^{-x}\zeta(x) - {2}^{1-2x}\zeta(x)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"As a result,"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\displaystyle \int_{0}^{-\infty}{{2}^{-x}\zeta(x) - {2}^{1-2x}\zeta(x)}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

title: Dirty Polynomial (200 followers problem)
body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"P(x)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is a polynomial of degree 200. It is known that "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"P\\left( x \\right) =\\frac { x-2 }{ { x }^{ 2 }+1 } "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" for all integers "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"  in the domain "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"-20<x<20 "}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"\n\n"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Find the sum of all coefficients of terms with even degree in the expansion of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"P(x)"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"We have "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"P\left( x \right) ={ a }_{ 1 }{ x }^{ 200 }+{ a }_{ 2 }{ x }^{ 199 }+{ a }_{ 3 }{ x }^{ 198 }+{ a }_{ 4 }{ x }^{ 197 }+{ a }_{ 5 }{ x }^{ 196 }+{ a }_{ 6 }{ x }^{ 195 }\dots +{ a }_{ 201 } "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Let the sum of coefficients of even degree terms be A."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"A={ a }_{ 1 }+{ a }_{ 3 }+{ a }_{ 5 }+{ a }_{ 7 }+{ a }_{ 9 }+{ a }_{ 11 }+{ a }_{ 13 }+{ a }_{ 15 }+\dots +{ a }_{ 201 }"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Now finding the values of P(1) and P(-1)
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"P\left( 1 \right) ={ a }_{ 1 }{ 1 }^{ 200 }+{ a }_{ 2 }{ 1 }^{ 199 }+{ a }_{ 3 }{ 1 }^{ 198 }+{ a }_{ 4 }1^{ 197 }+{ a }_{ 5 }{ 1 }^{ 196 }+{ a }_{ 6 }{ 1 }^{ 195 }\dots +{ a }_{ 201 }\\ \qquad ={ a }_{ 1 }+{ a }_{ 2 }+{ a }_{ 3 }+{ a }_{ 4 }+{ a }_{ 5 }+{ a }_{ 6 }+{ a }_{ 7 }+{ a }_{ 8 }+\dots +{ a }_{ 201 }"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"P\left( -1 \right) ={ a }_{ 1 }{ \left( -1 \right)  }^{ 200 }+{ a }_{ 2 }{ \left( -1 \right)  }^{ 199 }+{ a }_{ 3 }{ \left( -1 \right)  }^{ 198 }+{ a }_{ 4 }\left( -1 \right) ^{ 197 }+{ a }_{ 5 }{ \left( -1 \right)  }^{ 196 }+{ a }_{ 6 }\left( -1 \right) ^{ 195 }\dots +{ a }_{ 201 }\\ \qquad ={ a }_{ 1 }-{ a }_{ 2 }+{ a }_{ 3 }-{ a }_{ 4 }+{ a }_{ 5 }-{ a }_{ 6 }+{ a }_{ 7 }-{ a }_{ 8 }+\dots +{ a }_{ 201 }"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"By these equations,
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"P\left( -1 \right) +P\left( 1 \right) =2\left( { a }_{ 1 }+{ a }_{ 3 }+{ a }_{ 5 }+{ a }_{ 7 }+{ a }_{ 9 }+{ a }_{ 11 }+{ a }_{ 13 }+{ a }_{ 15 }+\dots +{ a }_{ 201 } \right) "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"This gives us "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"P\left( -1 \right) +P\left( 1 \right) =2A"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"So "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"A=\frac { P\left( -1 \right) +P\left( 1 \right)  }{ 2 } "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Now putting the value of P(x) for integer x in domain -20 to 20, we get"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"A=\frac { \frac { -1-2 }{ { \left( -1 \right)  }^{ 2 }+1 } +\frac { 1-2 }{ { 1 }^{ 2 }+1 }  }{ 2 } "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Simplifying, 
"},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"A=\boxed { -1 } "}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

title: 200 Followers Problem!
body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"A rocket is fired vertically upwards and Moves with a net acceleration of "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"20{ms}^{-2}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"
After one minute, The fuel is exhausted. The time taken by the rocket to reach the highest point after the fuel is exhausted is nearly "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x\ minutes"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Calculate "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"200*x"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Details and Assupmtions"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Assume  Gravity to be "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"10{ms}^{-2}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"The problem poser has unnecessarily complicated the problem.Here's an easier solution  :"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Consider the situation till the fuel of rocket is exhausted.Here , "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"u_1=0m/s \quad ,\quad a_1=20 m/s^2 \quad , \quad t_1=60 sec \\ \Rightarrow v_1 =u_1 + a_1t_1 \\ \Rightarrow v_1=0+(20)(60) \\ \Rightarrow v_1=1200m/s"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Consider the case when the rocket gets stationary at the highest point since the fuel is exhausted. Here :"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"u_2=v_1=1200m/s \quad , \quad v_2=0m/s^2 \quad, \quad a_2=-10m/s^2\quad,\quad t_2=x \\ \Rightarrow v_2=u_2+a_2t_2 \\ \Rightarrow 0 = 1200+(-10)(x) \\ \Rightarrow -1200=-10x \\ \Rightarrow x=120sec=2mins \\ \Rightarrow \Large\boxed{200x=400}"}],"attrs":{"inline":false}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}

replies.body: {"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":" "},{"type":"mention","content":[{"type":"text","text":" @Muhammad Arifur Rahman – "}],"attrs":[{"profile":""}]},{"type":"text","text":" Nice. I am eagerly waiting for it ☺ "}]},{"type":"text","text":" "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            Ok. Then let's approach a bit further. You can make it more realistic, You just have to use this equation, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"W=\text{GMm}(\frac{1}{a}-\frac{1}{b})"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" . "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Calculus would help. "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"I'm inspired from your brilliant problem and I'll be sharing a new problem with some more sophisticated calculations , and more realistically ."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"....Hope you enjoy solving that "},{"type":"text","text":"Upcoming Problem!","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            Yeah you are certainly right.Don't take this problem with respect to real life.In real life , we must also have air resistance as the major factor.Yeah , the value of ""},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"g"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"" will decrease but this problem has been framed for constant acceleration."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"If you are comparing this problem with the working of NASA,this comparison is absolutely inappropriate.There are lot of factors that NASA has to consider before experimentation.This problem is just a special case and has been framed for the understanding of physics learners.I hope you understand.Thanks!

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

comments.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            You and and also the Challenge Master are assuming "},{"type":"text","text":"g","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":" to be constant. But it reality, "},{"type":"text","text":"for a rocket, especially","marks":[{"type":"italic"}]},{"type":"text","text":" we have to take in account that "},{"type":"text","text":"g","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":" varies ( decreases ) as it gains height."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"So NASA would "},{"type":"text","text":"make a huge mess","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":" if they use our this such easy calculations. They would need a little bit "},{"type":"text","text":"Calculus","marks":[{"type":"bold"}]},{"type":"text","text":" for this!!!

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                        

                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                            

                                            
                                            First, solve for initial velocity.
v=at
v=20(60)=1200m/s
Then solve for distance the rocket goes with velocity initial of 1200 m/s.
v=(2gx)^0.5
x=73469.3877 m
Then use X=vt+0.5at^2
73469.3877=1200(t)+0.5(-9.8)(x^2)
t=122.448 s
This is around 2 minutes.
2 times 200 is 400
400 is the final answer."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Note I used g as 9.8 instead of 10.

                                        "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                        
                                            
                                        

                                        

                                        
    

    


                                    "}]}

discussion.body:
{"type":"doc","content":[{"type":"text","text":"
                                
                                
                                
                                    
                                        "},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Since the Rocket Starts from the ground, therefore, u=0"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"t=60 Seconds."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Acceleration=20 "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"{ms}^{-2}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"According to the first Equation of Motion, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"v=u+at"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Therefore,  Speed of the rocket= 1200 m/s after the fuel is exhausted."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Now, After the fuel is exhausted, Initial Speed "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"u"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" = 1200 m/s"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Final Speed "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"v"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"= 0 m/s."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Acceleration= "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"-10{ms}^{-2}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"According to the third equation of Motion, "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"{v}^{2}-{u}^{2}=2as"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":" a=acceleration"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"s= Distance. "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"= "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"0-{1200}^{2}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":"= "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"2*-10*x"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"x=72000 m"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Now, Using the Third Equation of motion, "}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"72000= 1200*t+ "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"\dfrac{1}{2}*-10*{t}^{2}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"72000="},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"1200t-5{t}^{2}"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"= "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"{5t}^{2}-1200t+7200"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"= "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"{t}^{2}-240t+14400=0"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"{(t-120)}^{2}=0)"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"t= 120 seconds = 2 minutes."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Now, "},{"type":"katex","content":[{"type":"text","text":"200*2=400"}],"attrs":{"inline":true}},{"type":"text","text":", Which is our answer."}]},{"type":"text","text":"

"},{"type":"paragraph","content":[{"type":"text","text":"Cheers!"}]},{"type":"text","text":"

                                    
                                
                            "}]}
